data.title: Graph Representation
data.solution:
num_of_vertices = int(input())
vertices = input()
n = int(input())

edges = {fromVertex:set() for fromVertex in vertices}
for i in range(n):
    edge = input()
    fromVertex = edge[0]
    toVertex = edge[1]
    edges[fromVertex].add(toVertex)

print("x"+vertices)
for fromVertex in vertices:
    print(end=fromVertex)
    for toVertex in vertices:
        print(end=str(int(toVertex in edges[fromVertex])))
    print()
data.statement:
Your goal is to convert the representation of a <<directed>> graph from an <<Adjacency List>> into a <<Matrix Representation>>.
In an <<Adjacency List>>, each row represents two connected vertices of the graph (edges).
In a <<Matrix Representation>>, each cell defines an edge from a vertex (row) to another vertex (column).

data.stubGenerator:
read numOfVertices:int
read vertices:word(numOfVertices)
read n:int
loop n read edge:word(2)
write matrix
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> Integer [[numOfVertices]]: Number of vertices
<<Line 2 :>> String [[vertices]]: [[numOfVertices]] uppercase letters, where each letter represents one vertex
<<Line 3 :>> Integer [[n]]: Number of edges in the Adjacency List
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> String [[edge]]: Two characters representing an edge of two connected vertices. The direction is <<from>> the vertex denoted by the <<first>> character, <<to>> the vertex denoted by the <<second>> character.
data.outputDescription:
The <<Matrix Representation>>. 
Top line: {{x}} + [[vertices]]
Left column: {{x}} + [[vertices]]. 
All other cells: {{1}}, if there is an edge from vertex a (row) to vertex b (column), else {{0}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your goal is to convert the representation of a directed graph from an Adjacency List into a Matrix Representation.
In an Adjacency List, each row represents two connected vertices of the graph (edges).
In a Matrix Representation, each cell defines an edge from a vertex (row) to another vertex (column).
Input
Line 1 : Integer numOfVertices: Number of vertices
Line 2 : String vertices: numOfVertices uppercase letters, where each letter represents one vertex
Line 3 : Integer n: Number of edges in the Adjacency List
Next n lines: String edge: Two characters representing an edge of two connected vertices. The direction is from the vertex denoted by the first character, to the vertex denoted by the second character.
Output
The Matrix Representation.
Top line: x + vertices
Left column: x + vertices.
All other cells: 1, if there is an edge from vertex a (row) to vertex b (column), else 0
Constraints
2 <= numOfVertices <= 26
1 <= n <= 100
Example
Input
4
ABCD
5
AD
BA
BD
DB
DC
Output
xABCD
A0001
B1001
C0000
D0110
